Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus we begin to read the paragraphs of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since you have completed this book, which is the last part of the science of medicine, for the completion of it, and for its consequences, and for its declarations, it seems to me that you have compiled it for yourselves in this treatise, which is a part of my operation, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation of my mother was prostrated in our region and in our time, totally deprived, until they feared losing the science of it, and its vigilance is outdated; and there remained no remainder of it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which muddy the most and endevour to avoid those errors and hesitations until their intentions are closed and its force is elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you will vivify this mother in the ordering of this treatise according to the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes into the forms of the ferraments of cautery and of the other instruments of the work, as is necessary for the addition of the declaration, and for its preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no artificial hand was found in this our time is because the art of medicine is long, and it covers the whole actor, denoting that it should be exercised in the science of anatomy, which Galen understood until he knew the juvenation of the members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and had knowledge of the osseous, nervous, and cartilaginous, and their number, and their dimension; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the places of their issuance.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that Hippocrates said that a name is moved, more in the small work, and greatly in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already said that about him in the introduction of this book; because whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy, is not evacuated from falling into error, for which many men die, thus you have seen many of them, because they are formed in this science and get away from it, and their experiences.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because you have seen a foolish doctor who has attempted to incise an scrophilous aposteme on the neck of a woman, and has cut some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed out until the woman almost died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another doctor who pretended to remove a stone from a man's bladder, which had progressed in his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone in a tube of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called it foolish to extract that, and I saw that because of the greatness of the stone and because of the disposition of the patient's thighs, which conduced under him, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he made a cruel incision on the black crust which was devouring his fracture in the thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, above the plague, with pulvination and astelation in strong structure, and did not leave the plague to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then I followed according to the wishes of the sick ones, and then I relieved, and then I left it for some days and commanded that we disband the ligament; and it was thus until the thigh and the foot were apostematous, and I came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have foolishly called it to him, and disband the ligament, and achieved tranquility and thus also alleviated some of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was confirmed in the limb, so that it could not be restrained, and it did not cease to walk corruptly in the limb until the patient suffered.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous aposteme, and it was ulcerated for several days, until the wickedness of it was magnified in the lord of it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cancerous tumor was pure melancholic humor, then it did not cover that it would come to him in entirety, but rather it was a member that suffered from everything, as if it had been hostile.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that, sons, it is necessary for you to know that the operation of my mother was divided into two devolutions: one is an operation associated with health, and another work in which there are major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed everywhere in this book where I found operation in which there is error and fear; because it is necessary for you to keep that and leave it, so that the foolish ones do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your arms in solicitude and protection of God, and your maladies are facilitated and are strengthened.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And you have used the better way by the grace of God to obtain health and laudable success, and you have left the terrible maladies of difficult healing, and you have kept your arms from that which makes you afraid, so that you may establish faith in your heart and in your name you are not evasive: because more remains in your glory, and thus it is established in the world and in the end among your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Sometimes I diagnose in certain clear signs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not mistreat a sick patient, so that bad doctors are not named."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have divided this book into three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first partition."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter deals with the head and feet, in the forms of instruments and in the furnishings of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"The division of the second partition."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, on scission and perforation, and on cupping glasses, and on poultices, and on extraction of arrowheads and on similarities to those, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"The division of the third partition."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on treatment of torsion and on similarities to those; chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"On cautery I focus and I bring acute medicine and reminder of the operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"I begin the treatise on the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"I know the quality of the youthfulness of that cautery and of its instruments, and in what complex situation it is prohibited to use cautery."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the youthfulness of cautery and of its instrument is long and prolix, subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves, and to me it suffices a small part of their sermons, fearing prolongation."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"Therefore I say that cautery universally comprehends all complex situations, whether it is a matter or several matters, except for two complex situations, which are cold complex situations without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the cold and dry complex situation with matter, they disagree; for some said that cautery is youthful in that, and others said the opposite of that, that cautery is not convenient in illness which is due to quality and dryness, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that cold and dry illness is healed by cautery."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And they say that one who says the opposite of that, that by cautery youthfulness is made in all cold and dry illnesses that occur in men's bodies, because when you compare men's bodies with the humidity of them to the complex situation of fire, you find men's bodies are fragile."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say through the sermon of that one, that I have experimented and already discovered many times at my own expense."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"Moreover, I do not know who can come up with something about that which has already been experienced and exhausted in the chapter of cautery through previous exercise, and has known the diversity of complex situations of men's bodies and the disposition of illnesses in their measures, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"Moreover, in the other complex situations, it is not about your fear, and especially in the fragile and humid illnesses, because all doctors have agreed on those, and do not disagree about the youthfulness with cautery in those."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And you know, sons, that the secret of cure by cautery is fire and its goodness, so about cautery I bring combined medicine, because fire is simple, whose action does not penetrate except to the member which is cauterized and does not reach another member unless adjusted with a small benefit."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"Moreover, the action of combined medicine penetrates to that one in the members where it is adjusted, and strongly makes it come into the diseased member with difficult healing and strongly helps."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"Moreover, fire, by its sublime limit and goodness of its substance, does not make anything except to overflow. And it is already known to us through experiment and length of service in studying the art about the truth of causes; and for that I have excused the length of the sermon. And if it were not that it is not read in my own book in this passage to you secret hidden fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of the expulsion by which it expels illnesses, a demonstrative philosophical sermon, which would be acute in your writings."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And you know, sons, that they disagree about the time when it is convenient to use cautery and pause at the best time of spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm from the accidental time is submerged in the youthfulness of that which I have with cautery, and especially if cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fixed, which do not suffer tardiness so that it is feared by those who come with evil, which is greater than small harm entering at that time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And it is not seen in your writings, or, sons, that which they do not esteem except the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that at that illness which is healed by cautery, there is no return to all time, and pause at that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not so obvious as the one that alters the complexions and dries out the humidity, which is the cause of the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Perhaps emperor's cauteries are excessive in medicine, wanting to demonstrate the value and truth of his operation and greatness of his lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his illness returns at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his illness, and its truth, and what has been prepared in his body by the aggregation of excesses in him, and what has happened to him in his acquisition of vices and similarities to those causes; but that the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in some members with few excesses and humidity, thus as cautery for toothache and similar to that, it is possible that in him it does not return that pain, rather it becomes less.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common speech is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and it is a desperate remedy, not because they understand it, since they believe it is not a cure that advances with medicine nor another cause that advances with cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is not so when we administer various methods of cure in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not confer, and then at the end of the cause we administer thus cautery, and advance thereby.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here on, I cancel the idea that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that gold cautery is better than iron cautery, and they didn't say it except for the equality of gold and the limitation of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make a break, as if it were not absolutely true, because you already have that probed and experienced that it does not make that except in some bodies with others, and cautery in that is good and better than iron, as they said; but when you do cautery with gold focus, it is not declared to you, since it depends on the quantity that you want for the rigor of the gold, and prepare to receive frost; and if you adjust over the igneous surface, the gold melts from the focus, and sometimes in the focus some layers are formed so that the artisan can occupy himself with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore it is done to do iron cautery more lightly and more profoundly in relation to the rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have now ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that one can easily find what one wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cautery for headache caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers on the humidity and coldness above the affected part of the body, which is the cause of swelling and multitude of rheumatic flux, called corissa, from the head to the divisions of the veins and arteries, and multitude of sleeplessness, and toothache, and gum pain, and universally all illnesses that come from coldness, as well as paralytic, apoplectic, and similar in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is this, that primarily it commands the patient to evacuate the medicine from the head, for three or four nights, according to the truth of the patient and his age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then make him sit between his thighs on a heated bench and place his hands on the floor of his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor in the palm of your hand, then put your fingers on the razor between your thighs.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Perhaps, as the finger of my own place has arrived, it signifies that place is tender, and then ignite the olive oil cautery, of which this is the form.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the sensitive spot, in a way that descends, as if my finger is constricted little by little, and you revolve that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and regard the spot, and if you see that some quantity of the head has been discovered, thus as the quantity of grain of errors, then lift your hand, and if it doesn't return to your hand in that iron, another of that, if it is frozen, until it is seen by the eye what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the spot and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the wrapped cloth in a bundle and leave it there until the crust of the focus is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the spot with four-part angel's hand until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plague bursts, so much better gets the arm, because it is better and more youthful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They should burn some of those that need to be cauterized on the outside of the bone, and hold the cautery inside so that it is burned in some part of the bone's structure.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then return to adjusting the bone, and then take care of the cure.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They should also make others who apply the cautery from behind, so that it penetrates deeply into the bone to strengthen it, and this is the way to alleviate small weaknesses.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They should estimate from that place where the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	It should be held in the open wound for a long time, and then take care to consolidate it.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two special kinds of cauteries in total, but only in some homes according to the way of fear; and therefore, you should tell me, it is better for my health, when it is; because the head is developed by solution of continuity with the aforementioned, as we have testified in the other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is most safe and better for me; and from that house and that work, I am healthy.
Capitol segon.	Following chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the entire head is affected by chronic and long pain, and it is in prolonged illness, and uses remedies and poultices and applications and implants and girdles and cadels and galenas and similants, and especially if it has been cauterized with a cautery that recounts and does not provide relief from any of those causes, then consider that the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not fragile and atrophied with much fear, then that cauterying should be done with another cautery below that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize above the crown of the dry head with a cautery so that the bone is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and discover the quantity of the os that we have recounted and cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head in the place called "vas" — and it is that place where the wind is paused.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand in that way, and do not discover the bone, because the patient suffers greatly from various pains different from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will direct this cautery to its place, because it is known that the cautery is the one that cauterizes the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than the one that is cauterized in the middle of the head; and this is the way of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery of non-ancient migration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When you find pain in the head's part, or it is a standing pain within the vein, evacuate with mondifying medicines, and administer another cure, which you have stated in the deviations of the illnesses; and if not relieved, then cauterying is done in two ways: either cauterying with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A cauterying medicine that burns is that you take a dollop of alum, and scrape it away and bind the extremities of it with both ends of the heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the place of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet into the bone so that it is in the very same place below the bone, so that it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen it above with a stopped constricting bandage, and leave it like that for three hours; and then remove the alum and extract the lancet, and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then pause on the submerged bone in a bath until the place forms a scab.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, I will give you some burning medicines which I have written about in the two treatises on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	A cauterying with iron is done according to this method: ignite the iron for cauterying, of which this is the form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is like a form of nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then pause on the place of pain, and hold your hand — so that the acidity which is beneath is not burned — and turn the small iron little by little with velocity.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is burned by the structure of the bone is as much as the marrow of it, and lift your hand so that the artery is not burned beneath, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak the bone in salt water and pause it on the place, and leave it like that for three days; and then pause the bone many times in a bath, and then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want, cautery the extremity of the cutting instrument according to the cautery, and beware of incision of the artery in this non-ancient migration properly.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of old migraines.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migraines in the way that we have said about previous treatments, and what we have said about the divisions of illnesses, and do not hasten the treatment, and sometimes for the illness that does not respond to what we have said about the first cauterization in medicine or of the cauterization with fire, then you should ignite the cautery tool until it is white hot, since it indicates on the line of the long duration of which is the greatest pain, or somewhere; and pause your hand for a while and strengthen that until you incise the artery and penetrate to the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful with the continuity of the jawbone, which is weakened by chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves that give bad signals, so that there is no spasmodic contraction.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood in the artery that is affected, because in the affection of it there is fear, and more so for those who ignore what they do and are not skilled and experienced; and thus the operation begins in it at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find the reminder of the regulation of blood flow in the artery according to the usual manner, in the same place of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not respond to this cautery and you see the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the same place on the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on the stretching of arteries with cautery having two points, and it is a better cauterization than this one and more convenient.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to cold and it is treated with laxative causes and another treatment which was said in the division, and the pain does not subside, then ignite the cautery, and it is this one that has been named pointed, of which this is the form.
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And place the point near the ignition, and it should be aimed at the environment of the whole ear, just as a wheel is turned around, or in the circle of some things if the pain is somewhere.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Also, you have the cautery of the root of the ear, little by little, because you should feel the place with your finger.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you cautery several points on the whole ear, and that is it, and then cure the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of sciatica.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Sciatica which is treated and with cauterization is not only of the species that come from fluxion, according to what we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	It avoids cauterization of the species that originates from dryness or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of sciatica with herbs and capypurgi and guarguarismes, and it does not respond to your treatment, then you should cauterize the illness with three cauteries: the first is at the root of the ear, the second a little below the same temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cautery on the contrary part of the affected area, because mollification is only seen in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the ear's extremity, slightly above the horn of the head, and in another temple, the length of which is according to the length of the aforementioned pain, and pause your hand on the cautery until the quantity of the greatest pain of the specific code is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a species of cutting, the form of which is described in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, more subtly it is that one should not be so vehement; and it is necessary to cut in it with excessive roughness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with what is described as a process until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter seven.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said and it does not respond to your medicine and the illness has no fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: on all the horns of the head; and with a cautery in the same place on the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it is cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more serious; and then it should be cured with what proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter eight.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	From the cauterization of oblivion made by weakness.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Because they give to the patient in the beginning great and pill-like servings of significant mondification.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then you shave the whole head of the patient and pause on the nape of their neck in this described implant in the treatise of implants.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And stop those somewhat vague things, because that is the manner of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do it according to that method in order which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore if for those healthy aspects; and if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of their head, which descend from the upper part of the head down to the back of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And stop between each cautery the thickness of the finger, and then take care to make the cautery as it is proceeding.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	Perhaps if you find the patient is tolerant of that, then make the cautery in the same place; and if you find greater tolerance, then cautelize over both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then take care that it enters so that it may be healthy; and let the olive-shaped cautery be according to the form given beforehand.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Because you should proceed in mondification of the head with jars and as we have said; and then shave the patient's head, and then make a cautery on the same place on the head, and make a cautery over all the horns of the head, and make a cautery on the back part of it, and make three cauteries on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of softening of the body of those who are tolerant patients and the illness is strong, then make a cautery with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and afterwards make a cautery until it is combined from the codeina motion of it, and elevate the same hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then take care that it enters so that it may be healthy, and let this olive-shaped cautery be.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not a case of cauterizing the epileptic, but rather that epilepsy is due to flux.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, since you mondify the brain of it from the beginning with years and another cure which we have dictated in the division when the patient is great and is tolerant of the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who does not suffer from medicines, then administer gentle purgatives and mastigators of the serving mondification, beforehand for some days, with good benefit of the food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then make a cautery on the same place on the head according to the previous manner, and another cautery on the occiput of it, and on each horn of the head there is a cautery.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then make a cautery on it with the cauteries that I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let the olive-shaped cautery be according to what has been preceded.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	Perhaps if the patient is an infant, then pause with a subtle cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and gross weakness, then make a cautery on it with the cauteries that we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluous decline into melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then give them something that mondifies their brain according to what has been preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient's head, and then make a tortoise-shell decently made of them over the circle, and then place it on the same place on the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be seated comfortably, and let them be held firmly from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then pause with a liniment; and it is more worthy of healing old wounds.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over the fire for tempered warmth by measure, which the patient suffers when it is mixed in them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put that on the same place on the head of it in the circle, and let it enter until it is refreshed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that with the patient for a whole week, once a day, another regimen of it is good until it is healthy; or if you want, make a cautery making small points according to the size of it, but you should have your hand on a cautery thus ordered: this is a special type of cautery which humidifies the brain in equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then pause that cut into healing or in greyish tints of gall.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of waters descending into the vein.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the beginning of water in the veins through the senses which you have divided into sections, then it begins and gives a bitter taste to the patient's mouth, which shows the head of it, and guards that from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that sweetener in a bath through certain daily journeys.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And command it to reach the dry head, and cauterize that with a pointed cautery in the middle of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of water in two veins, or one side if it is the beginning of water in one vein.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	You will cauterize all the veins and arteries, which you have placed on the spine; and you will place the cauteries in that long longitude at the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of fluxes of blood when it is cauterized; and if you see the fluxes of blood, or apply some medicine, which is possibly available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find wisdom in the extraction of arteries and their excision, and beware of the fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in the neck between two bones with two cauteries, producing immediate results.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the Cauterization of Ancient Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the veins are ancient and assuaged through the veins and arteries which are in the manifest place of the head before, and it is verified that this is a superfluous flux of phlegmatic humor, then cauterize that with a pointed cautery which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water flowing into the veins, and cauterize in the middle of the head and with two cauteries on the temples, and with two cauteries between two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to induce addition, then cauterize that on the entire side of the vein above the extremity of the eyebrow with a small pointed cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the Cauterization of Foul Odors of the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you medicate that with water which we have said in the division and do not hasten your medication, then prepare it and give it to the patient to drink for three nights; and place the head of it, and cauterize it with a pointed cautery or with an olive-pointed cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a keyed cautery or with two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of the artery that you do not injure it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the keyed cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the Cauterization of Softening of the Eyelids of the Veins.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the vein is softened by disease or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery or with this lunar cautery; and this is its form.
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, cauterize that above the two eyebrows, a small one, with two cauteries in the entire affected area, and thus lengthen the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the longitude of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is affected.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the Cauterization of the Eyelid of the Vein when the Skin is Converted into the Inner Parts and Pounds the Vein.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the vein is converted into the inner parts and pounds the vein, cauterize it in two manners, because either a hot iron or a burning medicine is applied.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you cauterize it with fire, command the patient to sit in front of that which liquefies the skin thus as those which are mundane, until they are prolonged and swollen; and if you pound that vein with its own force, then strengthen the veins of it with a bandage so that it is not weakened until the skin is born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Since they are born and swollen, then pause the head of the patient in the tender seat, and place a sign above the eyelid of the veins of it with a tent, as a signal which is according to the figure of the leaf of myrtle, and let it be the beginning of the proper signal of the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then pause with a cotton cloth in an album of veins or in a poultice of powdered salt above the vein.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cautery, which is its form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize above the figure which is signed, little by little, in well-veiled motions, until the surface of the spine which is thus as a leaf of myrtle, entirely and properly apparent.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the signal of health in this work is that you see the eyelid of the vein already constricted and the skin of it elevated from the puncture of the vein.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then raise your hand and let it rest for three days, and then place a bandage over the affected area to reduce the inflammation.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that wound with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the skin returns to its original state for some reason and the eyelid is softened, then do another pass with the cautery over the entire area as you had done previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is on the eyelid below, then cauterize it until it is elevated to its natural place and is equalized, so that the skin does not touch the wheel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery is a burning medicine that commands the patient to lift the skin until it is prolonged and equalized, and then make a template of paper in the form of a leaf of myrtle.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a gentle grasp with a living vein and a hollow reed. I apologize for the mistake. Here is a revised translation: Or that water, and then mix those causes well, and do that fasting for so long as not to be harmed; and then spread it over the paper which was made thus in the form of a myrtle leaf, and place that on one wheel of two; and place below the wheel a gut encased in albumen, and the head of the patient is in the tieu seat.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the finger on the medicine and press it a little and not too much until the patient feels the sting of the medicine, for the sting is in it like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And then as you perceive that the sting is felt, then release the medicine and touch it with your finger; then as the sting ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the wheel with water; and then consider if the eyelid has been lifted thus as it has been washed free of constriction or incision, for then it is well; and if not, return to that point of the medicine where you did not apply the medicine and do not deny until your operation is equalized and the wheel is constricted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the affected area with a bandage until the code of the adjustment is eradicated, and then treat that wound with a definite ointment or another until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, from your operation to keep diligent vigilance that no residue of the medicine falls on the wheel, and if the eyelid after some days is softened and some cause of the skin touches the wheel, then repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid is softened, and properly thus as you did at the beginning, and then send it in to be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of the myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the wheels of men are diversified according to magnitude and littleness, and thus according to what is done your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And it will not be misleading the way of straightness towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with water that we have said in the divisions of the illnesses and do not confuse your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to place their head in the tie seat, and hold the head of some minister between the ties more in such a way that it is neither moved nor agitated in the tied head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the affected area in an album of skin or in a poultice of ptilli over the wheel of it.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be conical, thus as it is the form of a reed or a feather's point, from one extremity to which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it should penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to come out thus as it is held.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But especially that which is burned is better for the tied work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then take the fistula if it is opened, and draw out its liquid and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on it the cautery which is well ignited, and take care that the tied hand is a little away from the cautery of the wheel at the parting of the nose, so that your hand does not err or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery in the grooves of the wheel and corrupt it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then at the beginning of the tied cautery, perceive into the bone, be it; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and let that thus for three days, and then place on that affected area with a bandage and send it in to be healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if they have passed eleven days and it is not healed, then place on the acute corrosive medicine until the bone is discovered and is scraped according to what is convenient in the sixth chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	It is another manner of cautery for fistula, which the first wise men discovered: then in the place of the fistula and make a pause in that fissure subtly as it forms; It is made with a quantity of one ounce of lead melted; and you hold your hand firmly on it, so that the lead does not penetrate to the depth of the ulcer; and cover it with albumen or egg white, or in water, because the lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it marvelously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed in the water that we have spoken of regarding the cautery and the cure, well; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a treatment through the nose and reduce the fistula to its original place in the nose according to how it will come into its own location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery of the fracture of the toes.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Warts that grow rapidly and produce fissures on the lips, and especially on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures in the way that we have spoken of in the divisions and do not deepen your treatment, then ignite the small cutting cautery according to this form that is shown:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And it is the conquest of it (the disease) according to the subtlety of the scalpel.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then pause that initial cut deeply in those fissures until the cautery penetrates to the root of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with wax until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth an aposteme is formed and then it breaks, and then it becomes inflamed, and then it becomes chronic, and correct the break and make a fistula, and then you treat it and do not deepen your treatment, then cover it so that you ignite the cautery according to the quantity that has been received in the fistula, and then put that ignition in the channel of the fistula, and hold your hand until the iron ignites at the root of it, and afterwards make one or two applications; and then treat it with water as we have spoken of regarding the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And then if the wound is abscessed and healed, well; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the location and lift the corrupted bone according to how it will come into its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cautery of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are weakened, and you treat them with medicines and do not confide, then pause the head of the patient in the correct position, and ignite the cautery in the form that will come out, even so that you pause the cotton on the tooth and insert it into the ignited cautery firmly, and hold your hand for a little while until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth being penetrated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times according to how you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should hold his mouth full of salty water and keep it for an hour, and afterwards spit it out, because the weakened tooth is strengthened and the softened gum is fortified and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or if there is a worm or vermin, or does not respond to medical treatment, then cautery it in the following two ways: either cautery with a cow's horn, or cautery with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a cow's horn is that you take a cow's horn and boil it in a copper vessel, and then take a piece of cloth and wrap it around the extremity of the instrument, and then immerse it in the boiling horn, and pause it on the aching tooth firmly until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat it several times until the virtue of the fire penetrates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge the cloth or instrument in the aforementioned horn, and pause it on the aching tooth, and pause on that ignited iron until the iron penetrates to the root of the conquest of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, the emperor's cautery with fire is that you attend to the quantity of iron or copper, and it should be in the core of some gross matter and the acuity of the fire does not penetrate to the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that will come, and pause it on the tooth and hold your hand until the cautery is cooled; and do it several times because the pain will be alleviated or on that day or on another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is good that by impression of that cautery the patient holds his mouth full of good horn and keeps it for an hour and then spits it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And you should cauterize at the point where you feel the most extreme pain, as far as it is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
