De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	About the purification of children and the cure of that which happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity thus like the other wounds: but however it is of our operation and of our will, and those of that are properly in children, it is necessary that we assign to them a better operation and a more gentle perdusion for their health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore it is said that the ancients did not practice circumcision in any of their free laws, because they did not use them in their writings, and it is only because they have acquired it by experiment, which cause is that they have trodden the major part of the artisans and barbers using circumcision and purification with a novacula and with torture; and they used ligament with faith and incision at the nail.

Maybe from the inflammation that is made by forfexs and I lament in good faith, experiment describes it to me, because the forfexs are of proportional insertion, so that the acuteness that is underneath is also as the acuteness that is above; and thus as you press your hand so proportionally on both sides, and insert accordingly with a comparison in one time; and it is made by compressing the faith in a figure containing the code of the entire partition, in which no error can be caught.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia. De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the treatment of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio. Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio. Capitol .lix.	Chapter 6.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	About the quality of cleansing of the veins with a clamp and similar instruments which are adapted to water.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there is ulceration or abscess in the bladder, or congealed blood in it, or it is constricted by pus, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then it is necessary to make an instrument called a clampcedra, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but on the outer edge of it there is a stopper, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three channels: two from one part, and sometimes they meet.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning it is a concave place, in which there is water that is impelled, and it follows according to the quantity that oppiles that, its addition, until when some cause is drawn from the humidities, it is drawn, and when it is expelled, with water it is drawn, and when it is expelled long, according to what makes the clampcedra phicate naphtha in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to draw out humidities from the bladder, insert the extremity of the clampcedra into the humidity, and draw with that water which is impelled from above, because the humidity is drawn into the cavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the extremity of the clampcedra into the navel according to what we have recommended in the syringe; and then impel the humidity with water that impels it, because that humidity will soon penetrate the bladder, and the patient will quickly feel alleviation.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the subtle crystallizer in which the bladder is crystallized, and this is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or copper, of which the head is so subtle that it resembles a small feather, and below it has a channel for introducing the ligament.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder in motion, and pause there the humidity that you want to crystallize in the bladder, and then tie it between two strong ligatures with a double thread, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the extremity of the crystallizer into the navel.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then stretch out your hand over the bladder with the humidity in structured descent until the patient feels that that humidity has already penetrated the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder present, then take a piece of papyrus and make it into that circle; and perforate it with all its retentiveness; and then insert a strong thread into those channels, so that they revolve; and then add the circle so that it is added also to the sofatur, because you pause in that water which you want from the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie it to the instrument and make it like that, as if it had been made in the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity penetrates into the bladder.

De extraccio de peyra.	About the extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division of the species of stone and cure of it with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and its signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that the patient should be placed on a bench where they can operate on them, and it will be a section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	The prepared bench is the one that is fixed in the bladder properly.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you will now give a clear and concise exposition and summary.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels. E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is rare to heal the children of that age who have reached 14 years; and it is difficult to cure in the veins.

E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And about that of which the bench is bigger and the cure is less frequent; And if it is scarce, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	So when we come to the cure of that, it is necessary at the beginning of that which modifies the patient with Christ's cross, which extracts all the filth that is in their sick veins; because that filth prohibits the approach of the bench, and it requires the investigation of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas. And then make that circle between your prepared hands, and their hands are placed under the hips of them, so that the whole bladder is made to decline towards the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then ask for that and all that is before it.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	So if you feel the bench in the space, then you will soon find yourself in a section above it.

e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and divide it into the water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, but near the left hip; and let the section be above that bench and the finger is in the anus, and let it be a transverse section, so that the section beforehand is wide and direct according to the quantity that you will make of the bench as possible, and no more, because the strong compression of the finger that is in the anus on the bench prevents the section, and it is forgotten due to its difficulty.

de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extraction, pointed, fixed on a shaft.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stones from women's bladders.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	A stone in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	Perhaps if there is a stone in some of them, then the cure of it is difficult, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of theirs is because the woman's bladder is very weak.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz. La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third reason is that you do not find a woman who knows this art, mainly the operation with her hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth reason is that the place of section on stones in women is far from the place of the stone, because it induces a profound section, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	Perhaps it is necessary to provoke you to this, then take care that you prepare a wise woman who knows the art, and few are skilled.

Perhaps if you are deprived of that, then seek a wise and subtle woman who is experienced in the art, or present a mature woman who is skilled in the art of women, or a woman who has a part of the art.

And make sure you have prepared yourself with the instruments which are used in the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be helped by them in your operation.

And if you see a flow of blood, and you know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is injured, then stop pouring powder on the location and remove those powders and structure downwards, and do not iterate this; and leave the stone and do not extract it, because surely the patient will die from the illness.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Then, when the acuteness of the blood has ceased, then apply cooling compresses, and the location will heal, then return to your operation until the stone is forgotten.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the section about hernia and ulcer.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia is not but an accumulation of humidity in the white membrane which is beneath the codename of the genitals containing the fluid, and it is named membrane.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some veiled things are in the proper panniculus which prepares nature in the partition of the fluid, until it is clear that it is another fluid; and it is the codename of the genitals between the white membrane which we have mentioned, and it is not this but a tumor.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to debility which affects the genitals, because at that point it is founded on this matter, and some veins are affected by percussion or a blow on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity has many colors, because the color of it is declining to citrine or sanguineous, or red, or it is black and fetid, or it is whitish, and that is what is worst.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known are these: because if it is in the white membrane which we have mentioned, then the abscess is red and declining a little in length, thus forming the shape of a fluid, and it appears in the genitals, because the humidity contains all that part.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper panniculus, then the abscess is red in the partition of the fluid and thus one estimates that it is another fluid.

De castracio.	On Castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias. E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore I say that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition or by making a fissure with a gentle touch.

A ensenhar las matronas en qual manieyre les enbrios bius sian medicatz quan yeysso segon figura no-natural.	To teach the midwives in what manner they should help the deformed embryos that are born against nature, according to an unnatural figure.

And those are small and large, and the blood flows from them at all times and it is one, and they are moved, and they are outside the anus, and in their extremities.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	Maybe those that are outside the anus are treated according to the measure of little humidity, from which flows yellowish water or a little blood constantly, and it is according to the color of the thing.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment of that which is deeply in the anus is that you order the patient to sit down and to exert themselves inside so that the anus opens up and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take hold of them and suspend them in an unción or you keep them on your fingernail, and then you cut them off at their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	Maybe if the nails do not hold onto them due to their humidity and softening, then take them with a rough cloth or a knife or a woolen thread, and extract them from their roots, and then you cut them off and powder over them some hot powders, so that they adhere to the place of cauterization; or cauterize them according to what is prescribed in the chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then heal them with another treatment until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey the exit, then you cristalize the patient in cristals where it is slightly numb, and wash them with that water which is in the anus and which helps the exit more easily when the patient exerts themselves.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	Maybe if the hemorrhoids are in front of the anus, then the cause of them is easy, and it is that you take hold of them with your fingernail, or that you take hold of them with an unción, and cut them off, and then heal them with water as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And that which has an incision, it is necessary to administer stitching of them according to this method: take a wrapped intestine and insert it into the needle and then extract the hemorrhoids from the above-mentioned parts, and make it penetrate with the needle in the root of the other part, and wrap both extremities of the intestine around the part below the needle; and strengthen the hemorrhoid in a strong structure, and then sew up the intestine and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And make it whole, and leave one of them open and do not close it, so that the superfluity of blood flows from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then pause on the anus with a cloth infused in rose oil or in wax; and pause it on the anus and order the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it until it scars; and when it falls, heal them with an ointment or another treatment until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many things are done hastily for excess or for constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are antiquated and do not have value in that medicine, then it is necessary to root them out with the point of a splint or with your fingernail until they are made humid and held back by the escar, which prohibits their consolidation; and then heal them until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you remove them with a root extractor, vigorously, at first until much blood flows and they are excavated; and then heal them until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	On the treatment of piles, this is clear.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that piles, this is clear, and it is not if you do not notice the redness according to the color of the body, resembling a head of garlic, and it is made in all the body and mainly in the parts below the feet and the fingers, and it is caused by those painful humors.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it happens that the nail has grown into the circuit of the claw, and has held onto the forked [fork-like?] or hooked [uncial?] part, and has been eradicated from its root; and then take care of that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you want, cauterize the following segment that is located in the seventh chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	More of a true eminence appears as a small, rough, rounded fistula on the surface of the body, and many veins come out in the hands of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure of it is to extend and insert that, or to stretch that with a file or with a pelt entering into the cage.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize that, according to what we have said, with fire or with acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And already eradicated inversely and non-inversely with the instrument which you call a director.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	More of a ant-like eminence appears as a small, rough, gross fistula on the surface of the body, especially in the groin, and when it touches that, it is centred in the semblance of morbid formation of anthrax, and it is situated around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure of it is to take a caneula of pea of owl or of pena of voltor, and make it strong, and place that over the anthrax until it contains the circle of the caneula with its parts; and then revolve your hand in the caneula until you insert what is in the circuit of the anthrax, and place that in the groin of the flesh, and eradicate the anthrax from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make that with a caneula of iron or of ironwork according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The lower part of the caneula should be subtle, solid (not perforated), enveloped in such a way that on top of it the absorption of it is abolished and the revolution of that.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want, cauterize the anthrax according to what has been said before in the chapter on cautery of atheya.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of instruments that are administered to give crystallization.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some veins are made crystalline with silver or gold or iron founded or molten; and some veins are made from those small and large instruments according to those that are administered, because the one that is administered in the cure of small children should be small; and of those whose veins are fragile or delicate, the crystallizations of those are small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and small crystallization:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the caneula at the bottom where the bag is tied should be wide according to this method; and it should be distinguished there where the bag is tied, thus sometimes.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it afterwards, which is inserted into the anus, should be solid (not opened) like a lion, and subtle; and on one side of the latz there are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel is according to the greatness of the roots and thus bigger one small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bag in which are placed the medicines of bladder of beast or of sheep's skin, and its root should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated for many channels thus as it is revolved; and if the space which is between the channels is too large.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those channels a strong thread of crude iron which is of ten threads, or around those; and adjust it to the bag; and when it is placed in it the bag, it should be stretched at the head of the crystallization between two distinct and strong constrictions, and then crystallize in each channel: More, the quality of crystallizing in that is that you fill the bag with medicine, which should be heated according to the quantity of tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should be placed on their back, and elevate their legs up high and place one cord above them on which already are the homes or a lancet; and then anoint the extremity of the cautery with oil or album of water or mucilage of fenugrec or similar; and then insert that into the anus to facilitate, and then the minister takes the bag and extracts it twice or thrice with vehemence until it is evacuated from the intestine all that is in the crystallization; and then extract the crystallization and the patient lifts their legs up high to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces out that excess, it holds as much as it can; and if it sleeps for an entire night, it is more beneficial in juvenation.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	More, if you crystallize that in the maladies of solution of belly and evacuation of it, then you iterate the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are emorrhoids or apostemes of painful wounds, then it should be crystallized with subtle and gentle cautery, among those crystallizations which children are accustomed to.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the cure of plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the cure of plagues what is convenient to the book, and I have said thus the cure of those with me and with medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it is said that wounds are diversified according to whether they are caused by cold humors and according to the location on which the wounds occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes why many wounds are caused by cold humors are so gathered together from pebbles, or incision of space, or cutting of a strip, or percussion with a lancet, or with a fistula, or with a sagitta, resembling those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Many wounds that are in the places of the body are also like a wound that bites on the head, or the neck, or the chest, or the belly, or the thigh, and resemble those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I strongly recommend the cure of some wounds because it stops that rational thinking and rule over the other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple head wounds, because the recollection of compound remedies will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when simple head wounds occur and are not fractures, then consider: if they are due to pebbles or resemblance, and you have already wounded the code so much alone and it is a great wound and you fear about that aposteme caught by the patient, then you should quickly cure the cephalic wound, and do not delay; and extract from the blood according to the quantity of its virtue if there is no prohibiting cause for phlebotomy, especially if the blood that exits from the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it is phlebotomy of the contrary part of the wounded limb; and beware of the patient's relapse and of vicious and gross vices.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	Many times, because of the minor prohibition, then it is diminished by the vice and does not approach flesh nor vice.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And stop on the wound, if it has caught an aposteme, as it becomes inflamed with olive oil or wine in which it is steeped.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	Many times, if it is certain of an aposteme caught, then stop on the wound, if it is recently with pure blood and the air has not moved that powder which I recommend to apply little by little.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then stop on the ulcers and poultices until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	Many times, if the wound is great or is due to incision of space and resemblance, and the lips of it are not adjusted for pustules, then adjust them with suture according to what I recommend about the suture of those.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	Many times, if the wound has been discovered on the bone and skin, and it is not retained by it except for a small suspensor, then incise that and apply careful cure to the wound with medicines and restore the flesh almost in place of the code, and command the patient to be cautious of vices in which there is grossness: caps and forms are joined together resembling those, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the code and it does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that rottenness and remove it, and apply careful cure to it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	Many times, if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which flows blood that may come out, and it is not absorbed by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find it not incised, then you incise it with a spatula, or ligate it; and if necessary, provoke what we have said does not conflict, then you cauterize until the blood is absorbed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of them is lighter; in this way that you powder over them with this powder, because consolidated there before the air moves them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take one part of oil of juniper, two parts of dragon's blood, three parts of unextinguished causes; grind everything thoroughly and sieve it, and from that let the wound be filled, and let it be constricted by good constriction until it be on that adheresca, and let it be coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And you strengthen that beneath with pules and lift it, and do not dislodge it while it is thus, so it does not become apostemed, because it is not eradicated from the medicine until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And some wounds make that alone with a sole cauterization, when it is not at your presence in juniper and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And I do this same operation in great wounds when it is convenient to stop on them and they are stretched, and the recent wounds with their own blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then it is not intended for the position of this powder, but rather cure those with what we have said, thus that you stop on those ulcers and poultices digested, or stop on those pores of the flour of the ordinary bread with water and honey until they get purged; and apply careful cure to them with another careful cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	Many times, if it happens on a fracture wound in the bone, and it is small, then you extract that with gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And you must direct the treatment of fractures of the head in that which is incoming.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the sores of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the sore settles in the neck, then it is not different in medication, and between the sore of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or constricted, then it is nerve damage, not in the engine but rather it must be avoided and cure of the limb that makes vehement stiffness, thus as wine and vinegar that seem to help and appear similar to those nozes and contractions.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not stop upon the sore for any total cause of all fever, because the substance of the nerves is fever and its continuation is in the brain, which is the source of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that which is cured by gentle medicines, thus as it is caused by washing with warm water, some infused oil in rosated or non-rosated, and this when washed with warm water and the other minor pains are diminished according to this manner, and humidity is induced.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the sore is great, then administer a suture, or bind the lips of it, and then take care to apply powder inside so that it may be healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the sore is deep or reaches to the lowest part of the putrid flesh, then pierce it in the place most depressed.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the sore an artery is cut and a flow of blood is consequent, then separate or dry it, or bind it, or cauterize it if necessary to provoke a stop to it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you have cut the vertebrae of the throat or all, and so saved the veins of the neck, then adjust the lips of the codena with a suture over the cane of the throat and do not touch it; meanwhile equalize it and return it to its natural figure, and then strengthen it in decent structure, and leave it for some days; and then take care to induce humidity in which there is stiffness and excitement until it may be healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the sore has formed an abscess in the bone, then pierce it, and then if there are fragments of bone, extract all those that you can from there; and what you do not apprehend, leave it until the sore may ripen, and be separated and the edge of the bone may be alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the sore is recent then powder over it with the powder that I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if in the sore there is formed a fistula, then take care of it with the water of which I will remind you in the seventh chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the sores of the neck or of similar ones that form between the shoulders and are formed with a spatula or with a knife or with a lance or with similar things.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of a lance or of a knife, and sometimes of its depth, then consider that if the sore has been infected when the patient was weak; then you will know that the sore is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the sore is recent with seven bloods, then you stop in it at the first hour of powdering, and do not strengthen it because the blood may be retained in the depth of it and return to the heart and afflict the patient, but rather pause in it an attractive humidity, and dissolve those two veins on the same day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the humidity is not present to you, then pause in the orifice of the sore as much as possible so that it may suck out what there is of humors; and make that the patient sleeps on the sore so that it may run what is in it adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if you see that the sore has passed three days or more and does not affect the patient with spasm or tremor of bad heart nor constriction of wings, and sometimes other good dispositions of it, then you will know that the sore is saved; and then take care of it with warm compresses and another cure until it may be healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of it is exhausted, and already all time has been occupied, then you will know that a fistula has formed; take care of it therefore according to the seventh chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the sore is by incision of a spatula or of a knife, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the back, then take care of it with water that precedes suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has formed an abscess in the bone, and then you have cut out pieces of it, then twist the sore and collect to extract those pieces, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them until the sore may ripen, so that the extraction of them is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other accidental sores in the other members, the treatment is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the sores of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that affects the belly is either great, or small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	From the large and wandering veins of the intestine or nerve of the intestine, because it is a faulty introduction of theirs and the suture of theirs being more violent and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And the disruption of the small intestine is a difficult fault for another manner, and it seems that the reduction of theirs is more difficult, if you do not quickly counteract the introduction of theirs to their proper place, because it swells and becomes grossly enlarged, since the instrument of theirs is faulty and difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the lesser disruption is better, because in that case it is not difficult to reduce the intestine, just as it is difficult in the two species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And we know that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common which are convenient for sutures of the other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other proper sutures communicate with the other wounds, but especially they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each one an exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is some cause of the intestine for that, it is very difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two manners: either by shrinking of the disruption as we have said, or when the intestine has been inflamed by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is so, then you should scald that in this way, that you submerge a humid sponge in lukewarm water alone, or that you cook in water with cypress, and spice, and embrocations, until the inflammation of the intestine is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And some wandering veins make it clear that there has been stipulation, and it is better than water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when the inflammation is resolved, then you should humidify the intestine with water in which there are cooked altaea and malvas, because by that the instrument of theirs is alleviated with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if it is excused from the instrument of theirs next to this cure, then you should divide the disruption into a small instrument in which there are inserted emollient roots.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the primary cure is better, when it is proper that there is no section, and there should be no occupation to section or fall into defect.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, thus you see the form of it:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the sharp-edged cutting instrument, and the other part not acute, and the subtle extremity, and it should not be in the subtlety of a spatula, unless it is obtuse by a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is amplified and goes outside the intestine, then it is necessary that its reduction be according to the form of its natural, in its proper place, if it is possible above all, because better is.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is large, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on their back, and place their legs more upwards than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you pause the head of theirs and the feet more downwards than the parts below.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then you should pause your attention and consideration at all times on this, so that the part in which there is the wound may be more upwards than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is necessary that you administer this in great wounds and in lesser wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, pause what is prepared for you, and prepare to make the minister among your most skilled attendants, who holds the entire disruption with his hand and adjusts the lips of it, and prepares to discover from that to him who knows the suture of some cause or another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one that takes the needle, or counts the number of stitches according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and prepare to release the extremity of the disruption with the ring finger, and strengthen the needle once, or you do not put faith in the two extremities of the cord, with two extremities of the ciphac which is below the cord of the divided parts, until you make it penetrate that part; and you have already added the two extremities of the cord and the two extremities of the ciphac, and so make four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And prepare to strengthen with double faith in the circuit of the needle, and some wandering veins of two parts together, and prepare to add the two lips and the wound for decent addition; and prepare to release the grossness of the finger and fix another needle in that, and prepare to tie it with faith as you did with the first needle; and do not cease from doing this if it is necessary with the needles until you have completed the entire contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And thus the lesser needles are between groseziness and subtlety, because the subtle needles move more easily in the flesh; and the large ones are of difficult instrumentation in the cord, and therefore it is necessary that they be lesser in subtlety and largeness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	It is not good that the needle is stuck in both extremities of the spine, so that the flesh does not become inflamed quickly and the wound heals before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	They are not prolonged with stitches so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the extremities of the needles so that they do not loosen the patient's sleep; and place powders expanded from all parts, which hold the extremities of the needles; and thus you will know that the wound is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And in these species of stitches with needles, it is more convenient to use them in small wounds, because they have been fixed with a single needle or two around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	Moreover, the second stitch is communal: and it is that you administer stitches to the four extremities, of the spine and two extremities of the hip, at once, with a needle in which thread is wrapped in subtlety and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, return the needle to that same part from which it began, so that the thread retreats in a subtle way from the wound, so that the stitch is according to the stitching of fabric with which the fabrics are strengthened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And stop between each stitch the amount of thickness of the small finger's mending.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this stitching is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And in this stitching I sewed up the wound which was inflicted on a man in his left belly, which had been wounded by a knife, and it was a disruption of the major wound of about a palm, and it was about two palms from the intestine near the navel, and it was a disruption in the middle of the limb; and then I sewed up that part where the intestine had been outside the wound for 23 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around that, and I cured him and he was healed; and then he lived for many years, and it was converted into his natural dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he could not be healed; and by a miracle it was done, because I did not cure him with ointment, because it was in a place where ointment was not effective nor any medicine, but I placed a compress on the wound for many days and nights, and I applied assiduous ablution with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	Moreover, I described two special species of stitches according to the narrative of Pareula.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with stitching on the spine, and you insert the needle from the front part to the back part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And then as the needle penetrates into the spine and in that same place it is rectified and lengthened throughout the whole body, and thus the extremity of the hip is where you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate from the back part to the front part in the other extremity of the thigh.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And then when you have made it penetrate, then make it penetrate another way in the same extremity of the thigh from the front part to the back part; and thus the extremity of the hip is in this layer, and make the needle penetrate from the back part to the front part in the other extremity.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate there your penetration, in which you make it penetrate into the hip in the extremity of the mirror, which is in the part of it within, until all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then it begins from this same side and sews that extremity which is of the hip on the other layer, and extracts the needle from the spine which penetrated, and then returns it to the spine and body, and the extremity of the hip which is on the other side in this extremity of the mirror; and extracts it from the spine which is part of it.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make it one way and another, and make it one way then another way until you collect all that is before according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of stitching is that you collect stitches of pellicles in which you collect the skins, thus that you collect the hip one way from the part of the extremity of the spine, and that you leave another way until it is completely joined.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	Moreover, the second species of proper stitching which Gualia recommends, and this is from serum of it and for its recommendation, it is that you collect it according to similarity with which doctors collect it, thus that they add all parts to their compared part conveniently by nature; and they apply the extremity of another to the mirror's extremity to another extremity of it, and this is done according to what I have recommended to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is good that you place the needle in the extremity of the mirror at your propension from the front part, and make it penetrate to the back part on that sole, and leave two extremities of the hip; and then return the needle and make it penetrate from the front to the back in two extremities of the hip.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then you return the blood flow, and make some penetrating points on the affected area inside to outside on two extreme parts of the mirror image, other than those in the opposite lateral areas.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than the common ligature, and it is a suture about which I previously mentioned remembering.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the serum of Gualia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And the dissected ulcer, the abdominal suture is rectified with two needles, so it is that you introduce into these a few threads, and begin with an introduction of needle from what you have, and make them penetrate inside the other lateral area according to the suture of those which sew up the hollow places.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And you know that when disruption is in a middle place of the abdomen, then the suture of it is more difficult than those of other places of the abdomen.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The judgment of medical treatment for plague is a judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	The cause is that when you recently contracted the plague with bad blood, before the air altered it, and reduced the intestine and sewed it decently, then paused over that carnal powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then pause over that ulcerated wound which is present within so that it makes hard and dry flesh, and consolidates the ciphac and mirror; and then heal it thus as is the healing of other plagues until it is sanitized.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you are not present with the medicines, then pause over that for the time being, because it begins to take a break, much effort, and exchanges those two vegetables daily, thus as you and teach, until it is sanitized, because you do not need other medication in many disposal positions when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague communicates to the principal members, then cover that you submerge the woolen cloth in oil of triple quality, or in oil roasted, and pause it in the circuit of the places that are between the veins and joints.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.
