Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	"However, if it is necessary to provoke ventilation for illness or for continuity, administer it every hour at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle place of it and at some time."
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	"The cause is that in those homes where blood is multiplied until it indicates extraction of it through ventilation and touches the heavy and swollen head; and from those, it touches replenishment and rigor in their face and in the heavy head, and in the heavy neck; and from those, it touches prurience in their face and in the heavy forehead, and darkness and dullness in the heavy wheels; and from those that throw the place of their ventilation; and from those, their blood is multiplied; and from those, they taste blood in their mouth, or the tongue is apostematized and spits blood; and from those, their sleep is multiplied, and from those who vomit blood in their sleep, rigor and antics and plagues and other causes similar to them."
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	"And then when it happens for some cause of those, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command ventilation to be done after two or three hours have passed from the day."
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	"And the remedy of ventilation of the nuca is that when it confers gravity on the head and to that which is founded in the wheels; but it covers that it should be a proper evacuation of the entire body."
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	"And this ventilation is at the place of fleobotomy of the cephalic (head)."
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	"And it is not lawful to use it on that which is of complete fragility, or in which there is catarrh, because it gives great nuisance."
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	"And therefore it does not cover that the use of those old things is in the heads of which there are frequent illnesses."
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	"However, to the one who continues above it is done forgetfulness; and therefore it covers that you command the ventilator to pause his hand a little at the ventosa on the lower parts, fearing the generation of forgetfulness."
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	"However, ventilation of alkehel is at the place of fleobotomy of the dark vein and of the basilica: and therefore it confers asthma, and to the constriction of the wings and to the scission of the instrument of the wings, and to all, and to replenishment."
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	"And it covers that the ventilation of alkehel is weakened a little, because if it is paused below, it generates debility in the body and in the stomach."
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the inflammation of the galle bladder causes accidental pains in the head and obstruction of the eyes, and migration, and foreboding, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the place of bloating of the basilisk vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And be careful that you do not press your hand on the scarification so as not to insert the artery and stop the flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And inflammation of the galle bladder causes fermentation in the mouth, and corruption of the gums, and resemblance to those bad things that are in the mouth, and it stands in the place of bloating of the astringent vein that is in both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	Moreover, the inflammation of the galle bladder that is made on both spoon-shaped (organs) causes a deposit, which is made by replenishment of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the inflammation of both divided parts of the focus causes juvenile bloating of three veins, namely the basilica, fusca and cephalica, because it attracts the blood from all those veins plus many small ones that are in the flesh, and those small veins are connected to the other large ones until they bring attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the one who inflates that he should not proceed with scarification, because the place is denuded of flesh, and there are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a type of inflammation which is inflated above the hips and causes hemorrhoids in the backside and ulcers as well.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And be careful that you command the one who inflates to have a great inflammation, and that it is of wrath, because the place indicates strong dryness; and strongly those subtle inflated veins are scarified in scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	Moreover, the inflations of the thin membranes are manifest through minimal effort, because they attract the blood from the whole body, and cause ancient pains of the joints and of the matrix, and of the bladder; and they provoke the menses, and cause bother and trouble; and it stands in the place of bloating of two siphons, and of the astringent vein, and of two cavities.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, I will not belittle the whole body and do not concur in synchrony with many homes.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the inflations, the astringent vein is propelled to juvenation at the inflations of both membranes.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the inflations is that it stops the inflammation at the beginning of the void and sucks for temperate suction, and does not prolong the position of the inflations, but rather pauses those ligaments, and remains in those quietudes, and that the humors come to the place for adventitious ingression.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease iterating that and continue until you see the place already inflamed and swollen, and that appears the rigor of the blood.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and properly consider in the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who has tender flesh from rare pores, be careful that you scarify him gently and not too much, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the one who inflates to amplify the scarification and press a little, and temper the suction to facilitate.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thickened, then be careful to scarify two gentle times, because in the first gentle time it opens the way of subtlety to the blood and to its acidity.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	Moreover, in the second (time) there is precise scrutiny acquired from the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very feculent, then make a third scarification for that it purges the worse.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a small amount, it is enough for us to make one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract much blood, we make a lot of scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then be careful to make deep scarifications.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which is the profundity of the codena only so much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that of which the codena is thick, hard, fusca, and the six pores are so strait, be careful that the places of the inflations are not too lenient, opened resolutely; if it is in summer time, thus as it is oil of aloen or oil of violet, or oil of amellas of dossas, or oil of cemensa of coja; and if it is in winter time, then oil of narci, or oil of liri, or oil of camamilla, or of blood, and to those that resemble.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, cold, then the oil should be amaranthine, or oil of balsamite, or oil of aloen, or oil of anet, and to those that resemble.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	Moreover, if the one who inflates is of many pores of tender flesh, then be careful that it is prohibited from oil, and be careful to apply those places of inflations with their proper inflation, whether it is washed with warm water or cold water of solatrum, or water of coja, or water of bordolaguas, and resembling those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if that which has blood of much humidity, wash their wounds with agreeable wine, or with water of myrtle and sumac and similar to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if that which has gross surplus, wash their wounds with agreeable vinegar, or with water of sanzuc, which is marjoram, or of decoction of anise, or of chamomile, and to them it seems similar.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the wound be kept away from bath; have care that it is administered its own dressing of bath for an hour or for two, and let it sleep with its own dressing.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that needs to be governed so that the wounded one is not blood-let before wound-curing.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	You should consider at the beginning: then if the wounder or he who needs to be blood-let is choleric and wounds above the agitated and inflamed blood, then you should take causes of cooling, thus with milky acetoses, and endive in agreeable and laxative, and scammony, and julip, and it seems similar.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their food thus with poultices, and remove the swollen veins, and prepare their food with wild herbs, and it seems similar.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if the complexion is fresh, you should take in drink essence of wormwood, or essence of scammony of sesame seeds, and sumac, and put much odorant miger among viel and noel; and it is commanded that he use few drinks and little eating, and pause their food of poultices and canabir and pissers and small veins and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And you should ensure that on the day of wounding and blood-letting, the drink is more abundant than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And you should ensure that it is given to drink at certain hours to certain men tyriaca alpharac, or medicine of musk, so it is musked, or alkalized away from the wounding or away from blood-letting or at a distance, so that the principal members are comforted and the blood is subtly; and do not ensure that they take that scalping.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	The wounds that are scarified are wounds that are paused on the feet, and on the knee and gout, and on the navel, in the places of the joints, and the pustule of the hip, because these members do not suffer scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not sought for those except attraction of blood from member, thus with paused wound on the mamilha in malady of flux of blood of the blood of the veins; and use that for dissolving fresh and viscous wound of member, thus with paused on the belly and navel; because that rarefies the member and scalps it and removes the pain as it resolves wound.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And already it is paused on the joints when they accumulate in their operation or pus, because through virtue of strong attraction the humble operation and eradicates the pus from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it happens when it is paused on the feet and knee, then wound pain is enclosed in those.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these wounds are administered with suet as solvent only; and some vegetables are administered at the focus.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some vegetables are administered full of water steeped in teas for the maladies of the knee.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that is why the wound should be filled and should be large, thus it is warm water alone or water in which are cooked suitable herbs for that convenience.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wound administered at the focus: let the amplitude of the orifice be two fingers, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the poultice should be the width of a palm; and let it be in the fat of it, in the place that is in the circuit, its width, the thread being small according to the quantity that enters into it with a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of raw rose or citron, of thick margins, lion, eagles and tertiaries so that the member does not leave its position above it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let it be in the middle of the vertical stick of raw iron or of ferrous, where the candle is paused at the focus.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this wound is much greater than that which we have recommended; and the little remedy of that according to the maladies and the state of him who uses that.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the wounds of the elderly and weakened are different from those of the young and of thick corsages.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this wound at the focus on the member is that it extends the wax decently away from a small candle of tallow, and pauses it above the middle of the vertical stick in the middle place of the wound, so that the focus is kindled around the partition below, lest the body of the patient be burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is paused on the member of the patient, and the finger is on the thread that we have said, until when we have the wounds and do not indicate that they open the finger and let the vapor rise over that thread, then the wound will be almost dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	I apply gentle friction according to my manual skill, and I repeat this if the said limb shows signs of inflammation.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	Maybe in a ventosa that is administered on the surface of the blister, with water, in which there is no transverse or oblique pressure, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed over the member as long as possible.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: This ventosa is better when it is larger, so much the better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 147.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Blood-sucking cups are not administered on most members unless on those members where it is not possible to position ventosas, due to the smallness of those, such as the lip and gum, which resemble them; or on a member denuded of flesh, such as the nose and gums, which resemble them.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found blood-sucking cups which are on the dirty, muddy waters of a polluted world.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then lay them in dirty water during the day and night so that they become foul-smelling, and that no remaining cause stays in the belly of those; and then evacuate the body at the beginning with fleabotomia and ventosas; and then cleanse the member of the patient until it is red-hot; and then place them on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and fall.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck from the place with a ventosa, it is better to do so in youth.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the place with a gentle touch and then apply a lot of water; and be cleansed and purified.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body of the patient is prolonged due to the removal of blood-sucking cups, and it is residue, then you soak a piece of linen in cold water, and place that on top until the residue is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is multiplied, then powder over it with triturated vitriol, or gall and similar to those of the stiptic causes, until the blood is absorbed; or place on the spot the crushed heads of roasted broad beans, and leave them until the broad beans adhere to the spot, and the blood is absorbed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And be careful, if it is necessary, iteration of blood-sucking cups, when it is possible to move them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the blood-sucking cups are prohibited from suspension, then cleanse the spot with recent blood or fix a needle in the spots until blood flows; and then place them, because they sense some blood as soon as possible.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall, powder over them a little of triturated aloe, or salt, or cinder, and it will happen soon.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is about the restoration of fractures and accidental dislocations in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, you should know that I have taken from this chapter the foolish doctors and the common people, and those who for a long time did not regard the books of the Ancients nor read a letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this manner of the scientists in our land is private; and I have not forgotten anything in a long time being entirely abandoned; and I have not acquired anything afterwards, except through the length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying with understanding of them, until I extract the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I will direct my experiment and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that contains my science and about which I have passed my experiment; because here I have abbreviated to you others and delivered it from the occupation of lengthiness; and I will abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and I will show it at the end of declaration; and I will form it in many forms of the instruments that are administered there, as is done by addition of declaration, just as I have done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter First.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractures of bones, from which a necessary premise is, before we begin the recollection of fractured members and diverse ones, each one individually.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	I will therefore set out in the prohemium of this chapter the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of those which at the beginning were forecast by the artisans and stationed on the truth of them; so it is you and those who are prompt that they may know or learn this noble art, other than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And then I say that when accidents occur, such as fracture or dislocation or twisting or breaking, then it is necessary that you return to the beginning with fleabotomia or to lift up, or to whatever extent, if no cause prohibits it, just as debilitation of virtue, or it is that to which accidents occur frequently, or in decrepit state, or it is a time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then I am content with a diet of fresh herbs and of lean meat from birds and crabs; and I prohibit gross meats and filling up on diets and all diet that fills the veins with blood, until you are secure from apostemic caution, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their first primary regimen, which they were accustomed to following.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And then when the broken bone begins to be restored, then it is necessary that the patient be fed with nourishing foods rich in nutrients and not heavy or greasy, such as light foods made from flour, water, rice, and vegetables, and fresh fruits, and similar to those, and according to this regimen, it is done for coagulation of fracture pus, easing and softening.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And it is known that the broken bones, when they are in the old men who are in the primary weakness and in the decrepit states, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are continued and consolidated according to their nature all the time due to the dryness of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated in the end of the frailty, just as the bones of the small children's fingers.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But the Emperor Nature adjusts and connects above the broken bone of the whole affected part any similar cause that grows into a mass that adheres and strengthens until it is fully consolidated and united, until they reach the end of fortification and firmness, just as at the beginning, until no cause prohibits their own works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to avoid the foods of the patient, foods in which there are gravity and viscosity and grossness, just as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to the variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And it is known that the species of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, because a fracture of the bone of the leg is different from a fracture of the bone of the head; and a fracture of the bone of the foot is different from a fracture of the bone of the back; and similarly all the other limbs are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I have come to remember all species of fracture, explained in their distinct chapter, separate from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fracture in the same member.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fracture of the bone are diversified in their members; because there is a curved fracture other than that which occurs in the stars; and some veins are made into a fracture according to the length of the bone: and so the fractures of the sagittal and stellar and additional proceeding and not-proceeding, just as it is done in the pain when it is prepared to write, and it is a fracture with plague and disruption in the head, and it is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to each species there is a proper torment in the restoration of it according to what will come to remember distinctly in their places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for that reason, a fracture of the bone is recognized: it is the twisting of it, and of that eminence and appearance of it to the sentiment, and so of it when one comprehends it with their hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And then when there is no apparent twisting in the location nor does it feel deviated from its proper place when one touches the bone with agitation and the patient does not experience great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there is a twisting or small fissure, and one does not feel it with their hand and with compression of all; however, pause over it from the medicines of which you have remembered to apply at that moment what is convenient for the location; and then it will be straightened by subtle stricture.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And it is known that the location where it is curved and not separated into two or another that does not occur in the sagittal, just as it is remembered from all parts of its comparison, then it is necessary to begin from your hour to rectify it, since it has occurred with apostema caution.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it has occurred with apostema caution, then leave it alone for some days until the apostema ceases; and then wrap it according to whatever manner you can of elevation and of ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And it is known that the restoration of it and the union of it are more legitimate than those of the bone in which they occur sagittally.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what will come to remember about it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	Many times in the bone there are sagittals, then it is necessary to extend this broken member from two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And it is your position in which you hold the member in place according to its natural figure, while the parts are extended from the broken member, then you perform that they return to their positions ingeniously and according to whatever manner you can put them in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And beware that you do not fall upon the patient through your operation of the limbs nor lesion; and perform yourself according to your true power that you apply one bone with another as a companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary that at that hour you profitably touch with your hand, and if sometimes there is a different cause here, rectify it and bind it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And violent extension and compression, thus with many foolish doctors who vainly try to accelerate the aposterior cautious operation, or accelerate counter-action in the member, thus as we have seen through the operation of their vain endeavors.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And you connect, equate and perform a decent operation and structuring of that member, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and make them understand that they should not move during their watchfulness and sleep, and observe their revolution and agitation, and remove their evacuation, and remove all their movements to total vertigo; and beware that the position of the member is positioned in a way that ensures the pain, which causes it because of the disposition of the member or lesion; then it becomes clear that if you change it to another disposition where there is no pain; and keep an eye on it so that the position of the limb is direct and equal, so that the limb does not become twisted when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the structure of the tranquil member is that which I recommend; for you should know that the members are diversified in their smallness and greatness, and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And among those that are small, such as the arm and finger and toe, and similar to those, then it becomes clear that the enveloping should be of very subtle wrapping.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But among those that are large, such as the thigh or leg, it becomes clear that in those there should be a strong and hard enveloping, because the strong connection connects the big member and strengthens it entirely in an equal structure, so that nothing enters inside.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, and evacuate with equilibrium, pause the convenient liaison according to that, on the place of that fracture in three or four envelopings, depending on how much the member merits; and strengthen your hand a little on the liaison.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see to it that you part from the superior region of the place of the fracture, and strengthen yourself so that you do not force your structure on the place where you have strengthened the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then elongate yourself in the enveloping of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the structure little by little, until you take hold of the place with a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelop that other part over the place where you have enveloped, and then see to it that the envelopings are parted below the fracture; and be your operation in the structure of the enveloping and in softening of that according to what we have said in the primary enveloping above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the layers of stopping the wrapping or cloth in which the twisting of the fracture is equalized, if there is twisting; and if not, do not pause in it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause on the other bandage, and then equalize over these envelopings which are decently made, just so, if in the place there is no inflammation or cautious postulate, and then pause on that which settles the postulate and removes the inflammation; and thus it remains for several days; and then you strengthen over the same layers.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And thus the layers of the bandage are of a certain thickness, and are formed skillfully; or they are made of rushes of cane; or of palm fronds; and let each layer be ample according to this form and figure.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it becomes clear that the bandage which is paused over that fracture should be thicker and slightly larger than the other bandages, and the length of the bandage according to how it is laid on the member in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen over the bandages with another bandage according to your primary structure; and then bind below decently according to what we have said about structure, and it is that your structure should be according to the place of the fracture itself, and when it is more elongated from the fracture, it lessens the structure.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it becomes clear that the threads are middling in thickness and subtlety, and are of a soft material; and if the threads are thick, thus as you have seen through the operation of several foolish doctors pausing the threads of twisted cords of the tort, and it is a great error, when the structure is not equalized.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And very subtle threads are not so convenient, because you do not constrict for structure in those things that you want, and it becomes clear that between bandage and bandage there is less than a digit.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is led by the extremities of the bandages to the structure in those places, then pause below those of stopping the wrapping or laminated skin until it does not make a lesion.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some vainly broken fractures are a plague, and cause disruption in the cord, and you will find remembrance in that chapter according to singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that all broken members are not straightened with bandages on the first day; the reason is that the member, when it is large, does not settle over the bandages until about 5 or 7 days, according to your securement of the advent of cautious postulate.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the plasterers among those whom the Ancients restored, who were experts in fracture and dislocation and twisting.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plastering as a remedy for restoring fractures, suitable for complex and major injuries to women and children, because it is about that which neither heat nor cold reaches: and it is that they take powder of millet, and it is the marrow of the flour that penetrates the movement of the mill in the walls of the millet.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And they confide in that thus, but not that they filter it with the white of egg, and pause the completion of it not sparse nor subtle; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another manner of implanting is for restoring fracture and dislocation: recipe of assafetida, of lapdanum, of acacia, of enula, and of migrach, which is made from a thousand granules salvaged, of all one drachm; of mirra and aloen one drachm; alochil one drachm; all are triturated and ground and mixed with water or album in order to complete the complex of the patient's scalp; and then use this implant, because it is of good composition and restores the broken bones quite strongly, and confers a great deal of comfort.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another manner of implanting which confers a fracture and dislocation: recipe of migrach and metal of white alta one drachm; of mirra and of aloen one drachm five; of acacia one drachm six; of Armenian bol one drachm twenty.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All three mixtures in a mortar with a mixing spoon, and filter them, and then administer them in water or egg white and they are administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plastering for joints and separated bones in those places, and then pain occurs accidentally in those and in fissures and fractures: take the woolen cloth and submerge it in warm oil and wax, and place it over the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	More in this plaster there is no virtue of restoration, of postrema heat and expelling pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster that restores broken bones: take leaves of fig tree sort and leaves of salvaged poppy; crush all together and make a plaster of it.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of plaster abbreviated administered for the restoration of fracture of bones and when you want resolution of the remaining heat of postrema: recipe mixture of elder, of chamomile and flowers of violets, of flour of peas, of all in a part. all three mixtures and mixed together in wine, if the member is not wounded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	More if it is wounded, then confide in that with water of sweet colander humid or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of plastering strongly in resolution that this first, when it happens postrema hard during the restoration of the member: recipe of mixture of elder and of sesame of lime, and of balsam, and melilot, majorana, flowers of violet, of chamomile, of all in a part; all three mixtures and mixed together in water of sage or in water of two waters or in wine, all that follows according to the quality of the member and the repose of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	More Hippocrates did not dissemble in the free will that it is placed over the wounded member during its restoration, but rather made a mixture of wax and oil and no other cause; and recommended that it be moderate between roughness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	More in Galen's opinion it is seen that they are placed over the broken member during its restoration and the causes in which it is exsiccated with little heat so thus as myrrh, incense and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plastering that confides in lesion and pain: recipe of migat, of cezès, of skins of wild goose or pennyroyal of auzel, and of elder, and salt, partings equally; all three mixtures and filtered and mixed together, and then make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	More the quantity according to which it is necessary that remains in the league and then it is dislocated, is that you consider if there is no pain or swelling nor the bone is broken nor is it moved from its place, then you do not delay for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if it happens at the place of vehement pain or swelling or inflammation, then you touch or delay that at the hour, and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a drap of lime and marine sponge, humid and warm, and submerge it in tepid water, and with that wash the place until the swelling and pain cease; and then lay it to rest for an hour; and then place on it the woolen cloth submerged in warm oil or wax, and leave it on for a night until you are secure of postrema heat, and that the inflammation of the member is rested, and the pain of it is mitigated.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then you apply that subtle structure and small implant underneath, which does not constrain your primary contraction, and subtly enter into that entrance so it may be healthy.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if sometimes the abscess and the redness and the pain and the inflammation are all removed from everything, and you have diagnosed the need for implantation and structure, then you apply that way as you have done from the beginning of the treatment.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of those causes affect that member which we have mentioned, then do not touch it for three days or four or five. And some treatments are all that is necessary for 20 days according to how it appears regarding the dislocation of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust in the structure more than in your primary structure altogether, and settle in the engagement of the food of the patient, according to what is preceded by the remembrance of it.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	More often the place of the fracture is disarticulated and extended more than it does not cover, then you know that the nutrient is prohibited from penetrating to that; and therefore embrocate with warm water treatment for 3 days; and loosen the structure a little, and through this operation correct the member by nourishing it, and it will be healthier.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	More often that which makes the restorative forces of the fracture of the member another way when it is not restored from the beginning, according to how it covers, and it is restored according to tortuousness, it is an error according to their operation, and great fear, and if it were a turner that which aggravates the Ancients in their free books and they would have worked on that.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them who have done that, because it is more reasonable that they do not do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter according to: On the fracture that affects the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and the causes are distinct, because some fractures are made by percussion of a spine, and the percussion breaks all the bone into the ciphac, which is beneath the bone, just as it would in the fist, and therefore this species is named ascial; or the spine inserts into some part of the bone, and inserts into its flesh and does not pass into the back of it; and this species of fracture is named absolute levation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the complaint of these two fractures is great or small, and of fracture that is contraction or attraction; and its cause is percussion with a poise or fall onto stone, and to their similarity.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating which approaches the peritoneum that is beneath the bone; or it is in the face of the bone, and the complaint of these two fractures is great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And the fracture is that which is diminished in the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair-like petiteness, and therefore this species of fracture is named capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is made either by fall or by percussion of stone and to its similarity, which makes some layer of the bone enter into the divided parts, and it is made in the concave location just as it affects the pores of the skin when it affects their percussion and it is a part of their entrance into the divided parts.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mainly it is done in the bodies of human bones, just as it is in the heads of elephants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And thus all these species of fractures are categorized, they are weighed just as they are separate stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will find a remembrance of all that in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I will discuss all these species of fracture for detection above them and for inquiry into their tents and ostentation of corrupt flesh that is above them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the capillary species is known for that which is discovered above the bone, and it is scraped, and limited to its tents, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	More often in the cure of fracture consider from the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see for the accidents that signify manifest significance over fear, just as it is vomit of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abscission of votes, and syncope, and acute fever, and worsening of the veins and redness of those, and similarity to their accidents in the major dispositions, if they do not get healthy.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see non-concurrent accidents, you hope for health, then you begin the cure of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is because if it has come to you the complaint at the beginning as it is a complaint and that is in the days of winter, then it covers that you study in the ostentation of the bone on the 14th day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then it covers that you touch or starve the bone on the 7th day, having that which is beneath the bone be corrupted by the peritoneum, and that the accidents we have recounted occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already penetrated the skull covering the brain, and it is broken into small pieces and fragmented, then be careful to collect the broken parts together and reassemble them according to how you will recommend it to yourself.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	It is that you shave the head of the patient plagued, and discover above the bone according to custom and manner as possible according to the figure of the plague, and that it be lighter above the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you need to make an incision in the bone, with a flux of blood or aposteme careful, then you oppose yourself to that which is necessary, and it is that you fill the place of drained fluids with wine and rose oil, and make the plague rest until the aposteme is sedated, and be sure of the flux of blood; and then begin in the circle of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And that will be according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one manner is that you cut the bone with an incision of straight style, and this is its form: And then administer another incision like this, a little farther later than that; and this is its form.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer more incisions farther later according to the need.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary to give you the number of diverse incisions, some of which are farther later than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are in the rear of the affected extremities, and are of iron or felt.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them to facilitate percussion on the incision so that it does not touch the head and lead to that.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then it is necessary to perforate in its circumference before you administer the incisions with the trowels, which are called non-deep trowels.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not so named thus except that those do not touch the term of the bone of the test to what is approaching it, so that the trowel is round extremity or margin above that which is beneath the head of the agute seeming like a margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passes the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take many of these trowels, a large number of which will conveniently fit the thickness of each bone, until it is present in all tests of the brain, the extremity of which is agute, the quantity in length and brevity being according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of trowels: The quality of perforating in the circumference of the broken bone is that it pauses the trowel on the bone and revolves it with the fingers until you know that the bone has been penetrated; and then permits the trowel to another place, and pauses what is between all the tracts the quantity of the grossness of the radius or environs it.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then you incise with incisions what is between each tract of the bone, and make it more subtle that you can operate on it in the end of levity, thus as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or at your hand, or for some other cause among those instruments which are prepared for that, thus as you have talons and forceps subtle.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it is necessary that you keep with all caution so that the incision does not touch any cause of the ciphering.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And thus you will have circumvented the bone perforating, and it will be separated from the ciphering if it is continued in it, and you will have extracted that, it is necessary to shave and equalize it in the asperity of the bone of what is in the other instrument similar to an incision, more imperial because it is more tender and more subtle than the other incisions.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you find some small bone fragments and splinters, then take them in a way that is facilitated by what is necessary for your instruments; and then cure the plague with liniments and unguents which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is ligature, far from pain, which Galen and the lantern demonstrate for great illumination; and this is its sermon: necessary is it to you at the commencement that you begin to discover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most vehement and most manifest, until when you have discovered that part and have placed beneath it the extremity of this trowel slow and gentle, of which this is the form.
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lentiform part is lazy and does not incise any cause, and the acute part is of it in two lengths beforehand in length, thus as times; that the lentiform part be adjusted to the ciphering on the face of the incident acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then you percute on the incision of a part with a small hammer until you incise all the bone facilitated thus as it is revolved, and you are sure of the scalp that does not happen in the accident that you fear in no manner, and if the medicant was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	When there is a cause annexed to the bone of the little finger in certain places of the bone, it will incite that of the hand at the extremity of the index finger, and it will be facilitated by the removal of its noisy and painful joints.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the little finger, and that which is absorbed or removed from the bone is its surface, and you remain in its roughness and subtle stagnations, then it is necessary to remove that roughness and eradicate those stagnations with subtle roots, for which you have prepared the number, of various quantities so that it is possible to administer them in all places most conveniently and directly according to what you perceive in your operation on the broken bone and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And it is necessary to administer in your reason the quality that makes the bone start with the most latent of those roots, and then use the most subtle part of it, and do not cease to do so according to continuity until you reach administering the entire tone and the entire subtle part of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.
