But especially the Roman joint according to its tortuosity; and do not note to the patient any cause, but that the hand is mollified and cannot strengthen any cause; then you will know that the nerves are pinched or compressed, and then it is not engendered in it unless it is strengthened with a pointed cautery for the correction of it and fortifies its confidence.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the shoulder is returned, then place on it the emplaster which we have recommended, and leave it like that for five days; and then remove it and leave it and the arm of it should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is hindered and falls into some gravity, then bathe it with warm water and rub it with tempered friction for several days, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the cure of dislocation of the toes.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Several days are needed to dislocate the toes completely.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a toe is dislocated to the back of the palm or to the belly of it, then stretch the toe and press the dislocation of it with the tied toes, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the toe, and suspend it from the part where it is dislocated, and leave it like that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is straightened in its own day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, lay it according to that narration, and do not cease to dislodge it in the day and exercise it with movement, and lay it at night; and do that for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly to that, if it is dislocated to the belly of the hand, and lay it on that part and do that for the first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do that when it is dislocated to other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it falls to one of the vertebrae of the back or neck a complete dislocation, and so many vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that case there is no cure, because death is likely to seize the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And it is sign of that, the effort of the patient is exhausted and beyond their will, and cannot retain it; and many days are mollified some members of it or two legs of it or two arms of it, or one of those; or a vertebra is removed from its place, because many days are removed and many days are made for the removal of that in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has been demonstrated in the back parts and is called gout of the elbow.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	Maybe the treatment of it is that then you should consider if the gout of the elbow occurs due to weakness, because then there is no cure nor complete healing.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	Maybe in this case you see by chance or by percussion or by similar things, the Ancients described the methods of treatment as verbose and lengthy; maybe it returns to profit; maybe you have already experienced relief from that which you had little excuse for, due to the proximity of my own exposition, in which I have expounded and formed diverse instruments from that which I will show and explain.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gout which occurs in the toe joints, there is neither engendering nor healing of it; and similarly in this case, it is made worse by two slips.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, none are cured except for that which occurs properly in the back itself, and that is what you recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be stretched out on their face on a low bench near a wall, and should be stretched out with many pillows under them so that their feet are not lifted.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stick should be placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the bench around the patient's head, and another stick in the air above their feet on the other side of the bench.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And one minister holds the stick, and it should not be fixed in a trench; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then envelop the patient's head and tie it firmly with a linen bandage; and extend the end of the bandage to the stick which is above the patient's head, and tie it there; and then strengthen the other bandage around their hips, and bind their legs; and then adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other stick which is above their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister should carefully extend the bandage to the part of the stick, and do not remove the two sticks and the bandages from their places where they are fixed, maybe even more firmly tied as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place their palms on the spine with great strength until it returns to its place, or should place them on a table, and then adjust the patient's feet on the table until they return to their proper position.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	Maybe if it does not return to its place through this method, then take a table whose width or length is in the air about three handbreadths, and excavate in the wall where we have said that it is proper for the patient to enter with their limb into the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the flat surface of the table on the spine, and the doctor should place their feet on the other limb, and stretch strongly until the spine is straightened and returns to its proper position.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, take hold of the one that is revolving around the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground behind the patient's head at the end of the two sticks, the length of which should be an arm's length, and behind the patient's head again at the end of the two sticks; and let the length between each stick be a palm, and already it is made in each stick a hole in which the cord turns, and each one should be firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stick in which the cord turns, and let it revolve around the two holes of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it there is a hole in which the stick is formed, the length of which is a palm where it revolves; and on the two other sticks it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then strengthen the bandages that you have stretched on the patient's feet at the hole which is above their head, and the bandages that you have stretched on their thighs at the cord which is above their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then there should be a cord and a minister who twists the cord with their hand, and the doctor should adjust the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the cord:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then since the spine has returned to its place, and the location is adjusted, then cover it with a plaster made of albumen of egg, and then stop; and then place on the plaster a table whose width is three fingers or around that, and its length is as much as takes up the space of the gout, and above the part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be tied with the bandage which we have said, and use subtle nourishment to help the patient until they are healthy.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains any weakness in the location at the end of the healing, then cover it so that medicines are administered which mollify and liniment with administration on the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and already it has been administered in that location a lamina of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some weakened joints occur in the back of the spine of the two, and it is judged for that dislocation; and it is that bone which already has been weakened so that you do not cover it with a prognosis to him at this medicine, because it will make his condition worse and lead to death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 21.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not only have a dislocation, but also a slight movement, and it does not happen to those who have a small movement and cavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, either it is dislocated to the inner side, or to the outer side, or to the front side, or to the back side.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated to the inner side, and rarely to the front side or to the back side.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation to the inner side is this, when you adjust the leg of the healthy person with the sick one, it is then longer and the knee is more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their knee, and it is the place where the knee becomes swollen from an apostema, so that the head of the thigh bone has been dislocated here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that which suffers from dislocation to the outer side is that the symptoms of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that which suffers from dislocation to the front side is that it expands the knee joint according to its natural alignment, but nevertheless does not bend because of the pain in the knee, and if it is forced to walk and cannot stand on that leg; and their urine is retained and their knee is swollen, and they have difficulty walking on that foot.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that which suffers from dislocation to the back side is that it does not expand the knee, nor can it bend forward because the knee joint bends, and their leg is shorter than the other, and the knee is weakened, and the head of the thigh bone has fallen to that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Moreover, the reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already become chronic with time, you approach its reduction according to its disposition, then it is not in complete cure; and therefore it is not possible that there will be a full recovery.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	Moreover, in the case where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocations, then you must take care to return the joint to its place and extend it to the inner and outer sides, and move it to the right and left, so that it returns strongly and does not require another treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	Moreover, if it does not return in this way, then it is necessary that you prepare a strong minister and extend the leg from the lower part, or with its own muscles, or with a bandage which is tied above the knee; and another minister extends the hand below the knee, so that they grasp the lower parts of the thigh; and you strengthen the bandage over the joint of the thigh bone, and hold another minister who stretches out the extremity of the joint.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And its extension is from the ankle to the knee, or from the inner side to the outer side of the hip, or from the back side to the heel.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And its extension is all of these in one way, so that the patient is elevated above the ground and remains suspended.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary to apply all species of treatment that we have spoken of for its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of its own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is to the inner side, it is necessary that the patient be resupinated on their back; and then pause the joints at the joint of the thigh bone in the place where the head of the thigh bone meets the knee; and then extend the joint from the part of the knee to the outer side of the hip.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes hold of its arms, and grasps the large joint of the thigh bone of the patient and extends it to the outer side with violent extension, so that it returns to its original place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of less gentle treatment, in which this member is reduced more than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	Moreover, if it is excused above you and does not obey the entrance to this species of treatment at all, then it is necessary that they be tied with strong bonds, gently, above both feet and both knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And its length is of each part by the quantity of four fingers, and the patient's leg is extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient is suspended over the top of the beam, and it is in a pulley; and its length from the ground is a quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to pull the head of the thigh bone, and it is suspended with another youth, and the other youth pulls the thigh bone with strong and empowering force, so that the joint returns to its original place with velocity.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	More in the reduction proper, when there is dislocation at the forefront of the patient, it is as if the patient lies on a pug according to what we have recommended in having gelbozitated the vent; and strengthen the ligament over the patient's leg properly and over their chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then place two cushions under him, one at his feet and the other at his head; and then place two adjusted cushions under the middle of the puerile ficatum, which wraps around the patient to prevent them from being damaged by the cushion being between their thighs, so that the extension does not reach the affected parts.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each minister extends to their part, and the doctor places his hand on the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if you observe a relapse, it will be great; and if not, stop on that diligently and thus as we have said in gelbozitation for that engagement.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	It is fitting that the patient lies on the soft mattresses, which are prepared in this way.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the anterior parts, then it is fitting that the leg be extended lightly, and it is according to this narrative method on puerile; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the loin of the patient, and then he takes the other hand, and with this contraction he stops the extension to the affected parts below the dentil of the forehead.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the posterior parts, then it is not fitting that the patient be extended to the affected parts below, and he is elevated above the ground; having said that he should be placed on a hard cause, just as it is said that the anchoring of his feet is dislocated at the forefront, according to what we have said about the positioning of him on two anchors; and it is on his face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there is no trouble.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is fitting that compression be administered with a table on the area where the joint is affected.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, since the reduction is completed as it should be — and the sign of the reduction of him is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the patient, and when you see those joints and the patient stretches out his leg and expands those six excuses, then you know that the member is returned as it should be — and then you adjust both thighs and place them in a bandage and stretch thus that the anchor is not bent in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the bandage, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those joints in their proper place, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and therefore the patient can walk again.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then you return and replaster it, and stretch it according to your primary structure, and let it be for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release it, and make him walk about on crutches for some days, until he is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the forehead.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The forehead is dislocated in three ways, because it is dislocated at the forefront, and at the back parts, and more at the lower parts than at the upper parts; and at the front parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you order the patient to apply his leg to the thigh; then you know that the forehead is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the patient sit upright, so that he stretches out his leg, if possible; tie both his feet to his chest, and place his foot between them; and then make him hold his forehead with both his palms, and return those between the teeth on the forehead in strength, and another minister extends his foot until the forehead returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of it is that his leg adheres to the thigh without effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then replaster it and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then tie those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then release them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not allow the patient to walk about for some days, until he is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	It is fitting that if the reduction of it to you is explained, then administer strong extension to the ligaments which are in the treatment of the preceding narration about the ankle.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Some ankles are reduced by small movement, and some ankles are dislocated according to completeness, and the dislocation of it is made either at the back parts or at the front parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that you see the ankle inflating proceeding to the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment of the patient's leg is a lengthy process, and it is necessary to extend it with facilities and ease the hands so that it returns inward.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	When treating a patient whose limb is displaced according to its natural alignment, make sure to straighten the affected limb, and hold one minister firmly and steadily behind the back of that patient in the middle location.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you place your right hand on the upper part of the foot above the ankle, and your left hand below the foot at the heel.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you pull the foot with your right hand, and place your left hand for two fingers, and stretch out your left hand; and you will feel the pulse of the foot on the inside of the leg.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make two finger marks according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then you feel the pulse of the foot at the third finger mark, and that is at the heel.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns to one finger mark or two according to this method, and if the foot is bent inward, it's good; and if not, then you iterate the operation, because that returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it with what we have recommended, then place the affected limb on a soft surface on the ground, and stretch out a cloth tightly fixed to the earth, and enclose it between the patient's thighs, and you have already wrapped it in a drap so that it does not displace.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister holds their thighs, and another minister extends the foot with their hands or wraps it with a bandage that lies on the ankle; and then extend each minister against the extension of the affected part, and the cloth remains extended between the patient's thighs, retaining it, so that the body does not pull away from the lower parts beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor reduces the dislocation with their hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh at the lower parts, so that the dislocation returns to its natural alignment.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause the plaster and stretch out that bandage strongly, and bind the foot with a bandage at the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful that you protect or guard the nerves which are behind the ankle, so that the bandage on it is not violent and holds it firmly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two days or three; and if the bandage becomes soft, stretch it out.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then remove it on the third day or on the fourth, and prohibit the affected limb from movement for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is forgotten to attend to that space, it is not done securely so that the dislocation does not become dissolved and corrupted, and then it does not receive a cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you encounter a severe abscess, then be careful that you administer in the sedation of it what we have described beforehand, in another place of cure and of embrocation, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that what is dislocated be bent with little extension of its own effort; and that which is not difficult, because it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the toes of the foot, then it is necessary to straighten the affected foot on a flat surface on the ground or on a table, and it should be steady like that.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and pause the affected foot on what you imagine to be the joints, and then calcify that in the affected foot until it returns, and you will see that it is already bent and does not appear in its eminent location.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then pause below the belly of the foot on a table that takes the whole foot, which has two cups, and then strengthen it in a decent structure and firmness for three days; and then remove it and make it rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and its return is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the species of dislocation that are made with a wound or a fracture or some other signs.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you encounter any of those causes, and you fail in the treatment of it and in its restoration, many finger marks will follow, leading to death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that reason it is not fitting to presume on the treatment of it, but only he who is wise in the art, with long usage, merciful and piteous, tardy, not arrogant nor presumptuous; and who uses in the commencement of medicines that calm down so much, and leaves the affected one to divine judgment, but hopes for salvation from destruction, with alleviation of the malady, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore it is necessary to strive so much to reduce it in the commencement of the cause, lest an abscess develops cautiously.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore if the limb returns according to what we will, then administer a regimen that calms down abscesses and cures the wound with what is convenient for it among the diseased and dried out.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is a fracture and it occurs in separated bones, then you perform the statement of theirs, and do so that we have said in simple maladies beforehand about the preceding places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and avoid according to your virtue that which is internal in the ways of fear, as it has preceded my prediction; because it is better for you to give thanks to your Creator, and may you be more permanent in your glory, and may there be more salutations to your body very truly in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus the phrases of Albucasim perfectly manifest those which God may bless.
Amen.	Amen.
